page.title: 16Beckingham(Lincs)_Properties
page.content: The main body of the village of Beckingham comprises some eighteen properties arranged roughly in a square, bounded by Sleaford Road to the South and West, School Lane to the East and Chapel Street to the North. Two key properties in the village are situated opposite the garage, occupying the two corner sites at the junction of School Lane and Sleaford Road, one being the Pack Horse public house and the other being School House which was originally built in 1840 and was used as a school until recent years when it was converted to a private house but still retains its original character. There are 66 properties in all in the main body of the village, these being a mixture of the old and the new but nevertheless still retaining the atmosphere of a small rural village.
